title: There needs to be at least 3 VGU's a year, not 2.
body:
There are so many champions that need to have their kits updated. The worst of the bunch are{{champion:36}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:72}}. They are all a complete mess both visually and game play wise.

Riot is currently pumping out champions like crazy now, while some of the older champions and their player base suffer heavily since they cannot compete with all these new ones who are loaded with dashes and power creep.

We are not asking for 6 VGU's a year like back in 2018. People just want the most needy champions to get updated like the ones mentioned above. The polls determining champion updates is just upsetting for those that are almost guaranteed not to win Such as Mundo or Nocturne. The poll system is highly flawed.

A lot of veterans love the older champions and are willing to spend big money on their skins to see them updated to current standards. Sure the profit is lower in the short term, but in the long term it would make more profit for riot and people are more likely to continue playing.

replies.body: There are so many champions that desperately need a VGU that I would be all up for devoting 2020 to 80% VGUs and 20% new champs.
I think they say they were scaling back on new champs after Aphelios and Sett
They are still coming out with like 4 or 5 this year, that's still a lot when they are already pushing 150. They have enough issue balancing what they have.
No, you are incorrect. They said that 2020 would mostly focus on new champions, and less on VGUs.

After a couple of the new champs I'm all for bringing the older ones up to the present, or give them updates that they deserve. Skarner and Karma I can think of, Shyvana and Nocturne are others in that same field.
No, there needs to be exactly ZERO VGU's in a year. There's enough removed champs already.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:08:18.768+0000)
>
> No, there needs to be exactly ZERO VGU's in a year. There's enough removed champs already.

Nothing wrong with updating champions to league standards as long as their game play style is virtually the same. The only one that was bad was the {{champion:266}} rework, everyone else got a positive reception.
This one {{champion:84}} definitely has no positive reception.
i like akali she looks cool i just dont want her in my games at all

Akali is frustrating to play against, hard to balance and hard to play. But, she is perfect in terms of Feel and Thematic, she is the best iteration of Akali in those respects, they could have done it without those first points but, overall it was a success considering what they wanted from her character.

Note: The creator of the Akali rework also created these champions.

Zoe, Darius, Thresh, Kalista, Yasuo and Aphelios. *cough* dudes got a track record *cough*
Didn't he also make Zyra?
Oh he did, he also aided in one of the best Reworks of all time Warwick.
Ironically he didn't seem to like that one since he felt limited in what he could do.

> [{quoted}](name=TÅ› Helikopotwora,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:16:12.228+0000)
>
> This one {{champion:84}} definitely has no positive reception.

Tell that to the thousands of people that mained her post rework, her pro play breach and her quadrillion skins.

The Akali players I talk to love her VGU. The reason why players hated fighting her so much was because she was brokenly strong on release and there after and often overpowered champions get highly negative reception no matter who they are, though it does affect assassins more.
akali players love her because she's 100% broken as hell.

No one hates when champs are OP more than their mains. The best thing for a one-trick is the champ to be strong but under-the-radar strong so they can get good winrates on champs they enjoy playing, without worrying about constant pick and ban away from them. Or worse, getting Olaf'd.

_ coughs in {{champion:43}} _

That being said, I am all for more VGUs, 
as long as they are willing to return to the champions they reworked if they messed them up.

> [{quoted}](name=Nomercyforyall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:11:42.672+0000)
>
> Nothing wrong with updating champions to league standards as long as their game play style is virtually the same. The only one that was bad was the {{champion:266}} rework, everyone else got a positive reception.

Shen's was pretty poorly taken. His play style is very different aside from his ult. This one actually didn't go over well, but he had so few mains compared to pre-rework Aatrox.

> [{quoted}](name=ChiefDovahkin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=000100000002,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:21:20.604+0000)
>
> Shen's was pretty poorly taken. His play style is very different aside from his ult. This one actually didn't go over well, but he had so few mains compared to pre-rework Aatrox.

So did Aatrox until he became absurd near the end of his lifetime and a lot of people started to abuse him.
still pissed about shen, at least before if he started losing lane he could poke farm from a safer distance, now he's got no range option and it sucks.

{{champion:266}} {{champion:114}}{{champion:104}} {{champion:55}} (shes broken is both pre and pst rework.) {{champion:82}} Auto win lane champion and Morde mains still crying for his old busted Q {{champion:54}} has no reaction either way {{champion:57}} E tied to bushes and % hp damage which makes it horrible for actually damaging enemies. People loved his ult anyway at least until people started just dodging the entire thing every time{{champion:78}} People complained until she got gutted {{champion:113}} No shit people who didnt play sejuani likes that she got changed{{champion:6}} See left{{champion:83}} see left{{champion:44}} see left. Certain vocal Taric mains on boards also liked this those people dont mind anything because they didnt like the character they like the meme taric the gay being the guy who likes gems. {{champion:72}} dont know anyone who liked this {{champion:84}} aome one else mentioned this
 {{champion:427}} who asked for this why do i need less stats to do what i already struggle at doing. 
The only positivively recived reworks ive seen in leage are {{champion:14}}  split community from people who didnt like the point and click low range CC and people who dont like that a fun fighter got turned into a clunky tank but again lots of feed back from people who didnt play the champ.  {{champion:113}} Was almost universally praised. Though some people didnt like her W being super clunky as it was a sustained damage tool before. I myself had a problem with only having 2 seconds of tankyness that often got poked out before i could go in I have no way to regain it mid fight so it bassicly stops me from throwing my ult to engage or ill throw it i cant go in cause i lost most of my defenses and no one else will go in cause im supposed to go in and they wait 5 seconds or some ungodly amount of time after i go in to follow up. no one likes her now because of the massive nerf to Her E which required other allies to pick into melee which isnt common in solo que {{champion:78}} Praised for not being that champion no one knows how to fight anymore until then people started complaining that they dont know how to fight her. {{champion:6}} praised for not having a useless ult anymore for bot lane. Doesnt get taken bot lane and shit stomps top with broken % passive {{champion:3}} Praised for now having a gap closer that is much slower than his old E. Divided community as he was just another tank rather than an anti mage. Buffed but then nerfed now hes still not an anti mage with his weak W passive shield.{{champion:83}} Praised for not being that champion thank no one knows how to play against anymore. Hes just dog shit now with more than Half his Power Tied into his ghouls just like before but he cant summon them on command now AOE still wrecks him just like before.{{champion:26}} Praised for getting CC at the expense of His ult Cooldown which then got nerfed even further no one cares but me. {{champion:266}} Praised by people who didnt play the champion before and Hash not realizing hes one of those people that only started playing Aatrox due to his mini rework before his main rework.{{champion:19}} Praised by people who didnt play him cause they took the point and click off of his ult In excahange he auto wins versus any melee champion  he can get to 50% hp and he can get them all to 50% hp.{{champion:62}} Praised on PBE as a good rework. I largely aggred but had  Reservations about his Penetration now being permanent in a fight but not going down to compensate. Now we getting the lazy rework.

> [{quoted}](name=Nomercyforyall,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:11:42.672+0000)
>
> Nothing wrong with updating champions to league standards as long as their game play style is virtually the same. The only one that was bad was the {{champion:266}} rework, everyone else got a positive reception.

I think aatroxx was good too. Changing him from aa based to spell based was a good choice that many older champions like trynda or yi would need to, to become healthy champions.
Wan't even a full VGU and I'm still butthurt about Malzahar

I was a S1 Malzahar main.

Until the rework that was uneeded and actually introduced issues that the og Malz never had like uninteractive laning (why AA minions with E when you can just use your cheap as fuck on demand voidlings?), while also nerfing his anti-dive anti-assassin role.

They made him easier to play for very little gain by this day.

Now he feels like shit to play with because he is forced to build glass while having less burst in exchange of more sustained damage. I miss being able to buy Ryliandri instead of being shoehorned into Luden's.
Ugh. People still harping on the Aatrox rework, like his old play style was somehow glorious and perfect and shouldn't have been touched.

I'm pretty sure a lot of VGUs did not get an initial positive reception, especially the early ones.  Sion, Galio, Poppy, Kayle, etc all had a lot of complaints about them as they were released.  I think the only ones that were relatively free of that were warwick and nunu.  Maybe Urgot, I don't really remember.

But anyway, based on the general complaints they have to deal with whenever a champ is VGU'd, I can't imagine why they aren't doing more of them...

> [{quoted}](name=underscores222,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=000100000003,timestamp=2020-01-19T20:30:07.382+0000)
>
> But anyway, based on the general complaints they have to deal with whenever a champ is VGU'd, I can't imagine why they aren't doing more of them...

Probably because these don't earn them new customers, but they lose customers every time they do one.  Customers that they can't win back.

Even after ignoring labor costs, (employees get paid regardless of whether they're working or not) every time Rito reworks a champion, their overall profits take a permanent hit.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika310,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=0001000000030000,timestamp=2020-01-19T22:50:26.367+0000)
>
> Probably because these don't earn them new customers, but they lose customers every time they do one.  Customers that they can't win back.
> 
> Even after ignoring labor costs, (employees get paid regardless of whether they're working or not) every time Rito reworks a champion, their overall profits take a permanent hit.

Why do you think VGUs don't bring in new customers? You think that when a champ gets a rework all the old mains quit and the play rate plummets to zero? That's not how it works. It's actually the opposite. Some old mains may quit, but many stick with it or even prefer the new kit, and the new kit also attracts new mains. That's the whole point of a rework. If it worked like you say it does, Riot wouldn't do any reworks.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=00010000000300000000,timestamp=2020-01-20T01:27:01.778+0000)
>
> Why do you think VGUs don't bring in new customers? You think that when a champ gets a rework all the old mains quit and the play rate plummets to zero? That's not how it works. It's actually the opposite. Some old mains may quit, but many stick with it or even prefer the new kit, and the new kit also attracts new mains. That's the whole point of a rework. If it worked like you say it does, Riot wouldn't do any reworks.

I said "**NEW CUSTOMERS.**"  Nowhere in my post did I say "new mains."  **PAY ATTENTION** when you falsely attack others.  I know full well everything you said & it's all 100% irrelevant to what I said, because they are two completely separate things.

The new customer pool is a finite resource, as Rito has been slowly realizing the past few years.  Meddler talked about this specific issue a month ago.  They're becoming cautious with the reworks, for the reason I stated.  On the other hand, reverts CAN win back lost customers, but those also might lose current customers.  Rito has intentionally fucked themselves into a corner where if they take a step in either direction, they risk losing customers.

He said in the future, Rito wants reworks to maintain aspects of current & previous kits.  They need to appeal to everyone, because failing to do so inevitably loses them revenue.  History has proven this.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika310,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=000100000003000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-20T11:55:47.553+0000)
>
> I said "**NEW CUSTOMERS.**"  Nowhere in my post did I say "new mains."  **PAY ATTENTION** when you falsely attack others.  I know full well everything you said & it's all 100% irrelevant to what I said, because they are two completely separate things.
> 
> The new customer pool is a finite resource, as Rito has been slowly realizing the past few years.  Meddler talked about this specific issue a month ago.  They're becoming cautious with the reworks, for the reason I stated.  On the other hand, reverts CAN win back lost customers, but those also might lose current customers.  Rito has intentionally fucked themselves into a corner where if they take a step in either direction, they risk losing customers.
> 
> He said in the future, Rito wants reworks to maintain aspects of current & previous kits.  They need to appeal to everyone, because failing to do so inevitably loses them revenue.  History has proven this.

The new customer pool is a finite resource at any given moment, but it does replenish over time. Many people turn 13 every day. If this wasn't the case, LoL's user base would shrink as current customers stopped playing for various reasons, and the game would die. Removing things with very niche appeal and replacing them with things with broad appeal is a good way to bring in those new customers. This only works with good reworks for champs who need them, though.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=solcvAUq,comment-id=0001000000030000000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-20T20:59:54.194+0000)
>
> If this wasn't the case, LoL's user base would shrink

News flash: LoL's userbase is shrinking.  Has been shrinking for a few years now.  Last year was the worst to date, seeing less ranked players in LITERALLY EVERY REGION than the year before.

Hence Rito's sudden rush to expand into literally every gaming genre & attempt to begin tapping into those potential customers.  A smart business decision coming from a company otherwise not known for good ideas.  Also an indirect admittance that the people up top realize LoL's "Gameplay Design" team are really really really bad at their job.
as a returning player all the reworks I've played with except warwick have been a purely negative change in my mind. I preferred the old champs the way they were.
Tryndamere needs to be on that list at least as much as Mundo IMO....
T R Y N D A M E R E

{{champion:90}} Needs a revert

There was literally nothing wrong with old Malzahar to the point where the only real nerfs he got was 50 range off his ultimate and 2% off his Null Zone due to DoT synergy with Deathfire Touch (So it wasn't even Malzahar's fault he got nerfed).

All the MYMU did was make him a spambot with fewer build options that cared a little less about positioning and even less about his voidlings.

Malz now feels like shit to play.

Its tragic that as someone that played him since his release, he is now extremely unsatisfactory to play as, specially against those he is supposed to counter. He barely qualifies as an anti-assassin now.
you can f right off adding nocturne and mundo to that list, nocturne is perfect and mundo is fun as is.
Add {{champion:63}} to the list.
So many Yordles are completely outdated.

>

My beloved Veigar got trashed hard with all the mobility creeps in the recent years. Many pros even suggested him to be played in bot lane because mid lane is better for mobile champs that can actually roam with good early damage.

lets complaing and ask for 6 VGU and then they can say "we cant but we will meet you in the middle and do 3" thats how you negociate

i honestly would prefer they do more reworks and visual updates than new champions every year
how about just a VU. ezreal tier VU. not volibear  level. they straight up removed him

Huh?
His kit isn't even revealed.
How can you k ow that they "removed him".
Lutzburg said that the playtester all told him that new Voli transport the feeling of old Voli very well into a modern healthy design.

I mean, i'd take his words with a grain of salt. Reminder hes the one that said "200 years of game experience is better than the playerbase feedback, and shit like Zoe, Akali, Qiyana, Yuumi were allowed to exist like they were live on release (Yuumi just needed a few buffs to then become toxic).

Have you seen what he looks like now? He looks goofy as hell and not like Voli at all. He looks like a fat rengar and not like Volibear at ALL. It's almost like Galio levels of "wait who is this? This isn't Galio anymore"

You also saw where yo get a free skin so that its not too different now? 

Besides, its not that different. Still a giant wolf-polarbear thing wit a bit of armor, just less... literally my mom's bear.

"The poll system is highly flawed."
How is the players decided who gets the next vgu flawed
